translation:
n. 食品杂货店; 食品杂货业

分布：杂货店(99%)，杂货的(1%)


US ['groʊ.sɚ-] noun SHOP  商店  countable (UK also grocery shop) (US also grocery store) old-fashioned ■a grocer's 杂货店
UK ['grəʊ.sər.i] US ['groʊ.sɚ-] noun FOOD  食物  groceries [plural] ■the food that you buy in a grocer's shop or supermarket 食品杂货
examples: 英 ['ɡrəʊsəri] 美 ['ɡroʊsəri]
n.杂货店adj.杂货的（复）groceries：食品杂货.

(1) She summed up the bills from the grocery with great care.(2) He's bound up with the grocery trade in some way or another.(3) A new supermarket opened across the street, and Peter's grocery business was soon in a bad way.
(1) 她非常仔细地合计那些来自食品杂货店的帐单。(2) 他同食品杂货业有着某种密切的关系。(3) 街对面开了一家新的超级市场,这使彼得的杂货店的生意马上萧条下来。
[sound:youdao-8f4dde26-57ab6ff1-db54269b-280e259b-494aaa5a.mp3]

translation:
adj. 总的; 粗俗的; 显而易见的; 恶劣的
n. 总额
vt. 总共收入

时态：grossed, grossing, grosses
分布：总额(47%)，总量(26%)，总的(15%)，总共赚得(4%)，粗鲁的(4%)，令人讨厌的(1%)，公然的(1%)，总共地(1%)，荒唐的(1%)


→来自拉丁语grossus, 厚的，粗糙的。可能来自ghreu, 刮，磨，词源同great. 即刮下来来的粗糙大块状物体，后来指大的，总的。
总共的;重大的[gross=great(大)]
a.总的,毛(重)的;粗鲁的,粗俗的n.总额The gross grocer crossed his legs before the boss.粗鄙的杂货商在老板面前叉起腿子.
【区】gloss（n 光泽的表面；假象；注释vt 掩饰；注释）源于glow和glass【参】engross（vt 吸引；使全神贯注）总的进入状态



US [groʊs] adjective adverb  ADVANCED  ■(in) total 总的，毛的；总共，全部
•A person's gross income is the money they earn before tax is deducted from it.个人总收入是指税前的收入总和。

•Once wrapped, the gross weight of the package is 2kg.包装后，这个包裹的总重量是两公斤。

•She earns £30,000 a year gross.她每年的总收入是三万英镑。
 Compare net
UK [grəʊs] US [groʊs] adjective UNACCEPTABLE  无法接受的  [before noun] formal ■(especially in law) unacceptable because clearly wrong （尤指违法行为）严重的，恶劣的，极端的，不能接受的
•gross misconduct/indecency严重渎职／猥亵

•a gross violation of justice严重违反公平

UK [grəʊs] US [groʊs] adjective FAT  胖的  ■extremely fat or large and ugly 极胖而难看的；臃肿难看的；庞大不雅观的
•I'd put on ten kilos and felt gross in my bikini.我体重增加了十公斤，穿着比基尼觉得臃肿难看。

UK [grəʊs] US [groʊs] adjective UNPLEASANT  令人不快的  informal ■extremely unpleasant 极其令人厌恶的；令人恶心的；令人不快的
•"Oh, gross!" she said, looking at the flies buzzing above the piles of dirty plates.“呀，真恶心！”她看着在一堆堆肮脏的碟子上飞来飞去的苍蝇说道。

UK [grəʊs] US [groʊs] verb transitive ■to earn a particular amount of money before tax is paid or costs are subtracted 总收入为；总共赚得；获得…毛利
•The film has grossed over $200 million this year.这出电影今年总收入超过了两亿美元。

UK [grəʊs] US [groʊs] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   [M] gross sb out mainly US informal ■If something grosses you out, you think it is very unpleasant or disgusting 使（某人）恶心；令（某人）憎恶；令（某人）作呕
•He smells and he's dirty - he really grosses me out.他全身臭烘烘的，非常肮脏——真让我恶心。

UK [grəʊs] US [groʊs] noun countable (plural gross or grosses) old-fashioned ■(a group of) 144 一箩（12打，144个）




gross, crude, coarse, vulgar

这组词都有“粗鲁的，粗俗的”的意思，其区别是：
gross: 语气强烈，指粗鲁、无礼貌，令人讨厌。
crude: 与vulgar同义，也指言谈举止粗俗，不文雅，缺乏教养。
coarse: 指缺乏教养，言谈粗俗，举止粗野，可与vulgar换用。
vulgar: 侧重指对听者的冒犯，往往强调粗野，言行、趣味不高，缺乏教养。



total, entire, gross, full, complete, whole, all

这组词都有“完整的，全部的，整个的”的意思，其区别是：
total: 与complete用法相近，但强调总量。
entire: 除了有whole的意思外，还强调既不能加一个也不减少一个的含义。
gross: 侧重指未打折扣，未除去成本或皮重等与净重、净数相对。
full: 侧重指内容，含有能包括所有的充足内容的意味。
complete: 强调事物在内容、程度、或数量方面已完整，已达标准。
whole: 比entire更普通，强调每个组成部分都包括在内，无一漏掉或舍去。
all: 有时可与whole, entire和total换用。


adj. 总共的；粗野的；恶劣的；显而易见的
 - robust, rough, country, dirty, bush
n. 总额，总数
 - sum, amount, total
examples: 英 [ɡrəʊs] 美 [ɡroʊs]
adj.总的；粗鲁的；公然的；荒唐的；令人讨厌的n.总量；总额vt.总共赚得adv.总共地

(1) The gross national product had increased 5 percent last year.(2) You can tell from his gross language that the man was uneducated.(3) They were accused of gross negligence.(4) That is a gross distortion of the truth.(5) His gross words and behaviors always irritate his classmates.(6) The goods are to be sold by the gross.(7) The new movie grossed an estimated $36.4 million at the box office.(8) He earned $60,000 gross.
(1) 去年的国民生产总值提高了百分之五。(2) 从他那粗俗的语言可以看出，这个人没受过教育。(3) 他们因公然渎职而被指控。(4) 这是对真相的荒唐歪曲。(5) 他的言行很令人讨厌,总是会使他的同学大为光火。(6) 这些货物是要趸批出售的。(7) 这部新电影总共收获了3640万美元的票房成绩。(8) 他总共赚了6万美元。
[sound:youdao-7622474f-5e9d922b-b5eb4175-bf96e887-ebf2e820.mp3]

translation:
n. 地面，土地; 基础; 范围; 阵地，战场
vi. 搁浅，停飞; 着陆
vt. 把…放在地上; 在…的基础树立上; 交给…基本知识; 使…受初步训练
v. grind的过去式和过去分词

时态：grounded, grinding, grinds
分布：地面(67%)，根据(10%)，立场(6%)，地方(3%)，背景(3%)，放在地上(2%)，使停飞(2%)，动词grind的过去式和过去分词形式(2%)，打基础(2%)，水平(2%)，困在家中(1%)


→来自古英语grund, 底部，尤指海底。后词义通用化。
n.地,地面,土地;场地,场所;理由,根据The boundary around the round ground separates us from the surroundings.围绕着圆形场地的边界将我们同四周隔开.



noun LAND  陆地  the ground only singular  ESSENTIAL  ■the surface of the Earth 地，地面
•I sat down on the ground.我坐在地上。
 ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■soil 土；土壤；土地
•soft/stony ground松软的／满是石头的土地

•The ground was frozen hard and was impossible to dig.土地冻实了，根本挖不动。
countable ■an area of land used for a particular purpose or activity （有特殊用途的）地域，场地
•a football ground足球场
grounds [plural] ■the gardens and land that surround a building and often have a wall or fence around them （常由墙或栅栏围起来的建筑物周围的）庭院，场地，花园
•We went for a walk around the hospital grounds.我们在医院的院子里散步走了几圈。

[graʊnd] noun CAUSE  原因   ESSENTIAL  countable usually plural ■a reason, cause or argument 原因；根据；理由
•She is suing the company on  grounds  of unfair dismissal.她正以公司不公正解雇她为由对其提起诉讼。

•Do you have any ground for suspecting them?你有甚么证据怀疑他们？

•[+ to infinitive] We have grounds to believe that you have been lying to us.我们有理由相信，你一直在对我们撒谎。

•[+ that] He refused to answer on the grounds that she was unfairly dismissed.他以她被不正当解雇为由拒绝作出答覆。

[graʊnd] noun AREA OF KNOWLEDGE  知识领域   ADVANCED  uncountable ■an area of knowledge or experience; a subject （知识、经验等的）领域，范围；学科
•When the conversation turns to politics he's on familiar ground (= he knows a lot about this subject).当谈话转向政治时，他便如鱼得水。

•Once we'd found some common ground (= things we both knew about) we got on very well together.在找到一些共同语言之后，我们开始相处融洽了。

•The lectures covered a lot of ground (= included information on many different subjects).这些演讲涵盖了众多学科的内容。

•I enjoyed her first novel, but I felt in the second she was going over the same ground (= dealing with the same area of experience).我很喜欢她的第一部小说，但是我觉得她的第二部小说涉及的是同样的题材。

[graʊnd] noun WIRE  电线  countable usually singular US for ■earth (WIRE) 
[graʊnd] noun COFFEE  咖啡  grounds [plural] ■the small bits of coffee left at the bottom of a cup or other container that has had coffee in it 咖啡渣⇒ See also grind
[graʊnd] noun drive/work yourself into the ground ■to make yourself tired or ill by working too hard （拼命工作）使自己精疲力尽，把自己累垮
[graʊnd] noun get (sth) off the ground ■If a plan or activity gets off the ground or you get it off the ground, it starts or succeeds （使）开始；（使）成功进行
•A lot more money will be required to get this project off the ground.要启动这个工程，还需要大量的资金。

[graʊnd] noun go/be run to ground ■to hide in order to escape someone or something following you 退隐；躲藏
•He found the media attention intolerable and went to ground for several months.他觉得媒体的关注令他无法忍受，便躲起来几个月。

[graʊnd] noun on the ground ■among the general public 在公众中；在普通百姓中
•Their political ideas have a lot of support on the ground.他们的政治观点得到公众广泛支持。

[graʊnd] verb GRIND  磨  past simple and past participle of■grind 
[graʊnd] verb KEEP ON LAND  搁浅  be grounded ■If a ship is grounded, it cannot move because it has hit solid ground 使（船）搁浅
•The oil tanker was grounded on a sandbank.油轮搁浅在一片沙滩上。
transitive often passive ■If aircraft are grounded, they are prevented from flying or ordered not to fly 禁止…飞行；使停飞
•The snowstorm meant that all planes were grounded.这场暴风雪导致航班全部停飞。

[graʊnd] verb PUNISH  惩罚  transitive ■to forbid (= refuse to allow) a child or young person from going out as a punishment 罚（孩子）不许出门
•My parents have grounded me for a week.我爸妈罚我一星期不准出门。

[graʊnd] verb CAUSE  原因  be grounded in sth formal ■to be based firmly on something 根据；基于
•Fiction should be grounded in reality.小说应该以现实生活为基础。

•Most phobias are grounded in childhood experiences.大多数的恐惧症都源于儿时的经历。
⇒ See also well-grounded




basis, ground, base, foundation

这组词都有“基础”的意思，其区别是：
basis: 主要用作抽象或引申意义。
ground: 含义与basis和foundation接近。一般指某种决定、论点或关系的基础，也可指某种原因的基础。
base: 侧重指构成或支撑某一具体物体的基础，也可指军事基地或用作比喻意义。
foundation: 用于具体意义时，侧重指坚固结实的建筑物的基础或地基；用作比喻意义时，与basis基本相同。



clay, mud, dust, ground, land, earth, dirt, soil

这组词都有“土地，土，泥”的意思，其区别是：
clay: 特指潮湿时发粘，而火烤后变坚硬的泥土。
mud: 指湿土，尤指雨后稀泥、污泥。
dust: 特指土壤干燥后，飞扬于空中的细微泥土。
ground: 通常指大地的表面，也可指土壤、泥土或场地。
land: 含义笼统。指与河流、海洋相对的陆地，也指可耕种的土地。
earth: 多指地表带有水分的泥土，较具体。
dirt: 指地表的干松泥土。
soil: 特指适宜栽种农作物或生长各种植物的泥土。


n. 地面；土地；范围；战场
 - extent, boundary, region, spectrum, territory, area
vt. 使接触地面；打基础；使搁浅
 - strand
vi. 着陆；搁浅
 - beach, to land
adj. 土地的；地面上的；磨碎的；磨过的
 - agrarian, earth's
v. 研磨（grind的过去分词）；压迫
 - oppressed
examples: 英 [ɡraʊnd] 美 [ɡraʊnd]
n.地面；地方；根据；主题；立场；水平；背景v.使停飞；困在家中；放在地上；使 ... 搁浅；打基础动词grind的过去式和过去分词形式

(1) You shouldn't sit on the ground when it's wet.(2) The expedition covered a lot of ground.(3) Boredom is not a ground for divorce.(4) There is no point in going over the same ground twice.(5) It said that they were all trying to find the common ground.(6) Germany in the 1920s and 30s was fertile ground for such ideas.(7) All aircrafts at London Airport were grounded by fog today.(8) His parents grounded him for two weeks.(9) They grounded their arms to show surrender.(10) The ship was grounded in shallow water.(11) She grounded her pupils well in arithmetic.

(1) 地面潮湿时就不应该坐在地上。(2) 探险队到过很多地方。(3) 日久生厌不能成为离婚的理由。(4) 把同样的主题重温两遍根本就没有什么意义。(5) 据说他们都在努力找到共同立场。(6) 20世纪二三十年代的德国以这些观念的盛行为背景。(7) 因大雾天气,今天伦敦机场的所有飞机都被迫停飞。(8) 他父母把他关在家里两个星期。(9) 他们把武器放在地上以示投降。(10) 船在水浅处搁浅。(11) 她给自己的学生打下良好的算术基础。
[sound:youdao-5ea4f6fd-720dad73-e490ee22-2e9c8b70-7ffc47eb.mp3]

translation:
vt. 种植; 扩大; 扩展; 增加
vi. 生长; 渐渐变得; 逐渐开始
vt. & vi. （使）留长，蓄长

时态：grew, grown, growing, grows
分布：生长(61%)，种植(30%)，增加(4%)，逐渐开始(3%)，变成(2%)


→来自ghre, 生长，词源同grass,green.
v.生长,成长;渐渐变成;栽培,种植;发展In my opinion, only the onion can grow in the iron environment.据我看,只有洋葱能在铁质环境中生长.



US [groʊ] verb (grew, grown)INCREASE  增长   ESSENTIAL  [I or L or T] ■to increase in size or amount, or to become more advanced or developed 增多；增大；增强；增长；成长；长大
•Children grow so quickly.小朋友长得很快。

•This plant grows best in the shade.这种植物在阴凉处长得最好。

•She's grown three centimetres this year.她今年长高了三厘米。

•Football's popularity continues to grow.足球运动越来越受欢迎。

•The labour force is expected to grow by 2% next year.劳动人口预计明年会增长2%。

•The male deer grows large branching horns called antlers.雄鹿头上长着分岔的大角，即鹿角。
 ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■If your hair or nails grow, or if you grow them, they become longer （头发或指甲）长长，留长，蓄长
•Lottie wants to grow her hair long.洛蒂想留长头发。

•Are you growing a beard?你在留胡子吗？

•Golly, your hair's grown!天哪，你的头发长起来了！
 ESSENTIAL  intransitive ■If a plant grows in a particular place, it exists and develops there （植物）（自然）生长
•There were roses growing up against the wall of the cottage.村舍墙边长着很多蔷薇，攀爬到了墙上。
 ESSENTIAL  transitive ■If you grow a plant, you put it in the ground and take care of it, usually in order to sell it （通常指为了出售而）栽培，种植
•The villagers grow coffee and maize to sell in the market.村民们种植咖啡和玉米到市场上卖钱。

UK [grəʊ] US [groʊ] verb (grew, grown)BECOME  变得  grow tired/old/calm, etc.  IMPROVER  ■to gradually become tired/old/calm, etc 变得疲劳／老迈／安静等
•He grew bored of the countryside.他厌倦了乡村生活。

•Growing old is so awful.变老真是太可怕了。
grow to do sth ■to gradually start to do something 逐渐开始
•I've grown to like her over the months.几个月来我已经慢慢开始喜欢她了。

UK [grəʊ] US [groʊ] verb (grew, grown)  Phrasal Verbs   grow apart (also grow away from sb) ■If two people in a close relationship grow apart or if they grow away from each other, they gradually begin to have a less close relationship, usually because they no longer have the same interests and want the same things （通常因为失去共同的兴趣、愿望而）逐渐疏远，渐渐产生隔阂
•There was nobody else involved, we just grew apart.没有任何外人介入，我们只是渐渐疏远了。

UK [grəʊ] US [groʊ] verb (grew, grown)  Phrasal Verbs   grow into sb/sth  ADVANCED  ■to develop into a particular type of person or thing 逐渐成长为，发展为，变为（某种类型的人或物）
•He's grown into a fine, responsible young man.他慢慢成长为一个心地善良、有责任心的年轻人。

UK [grəʊ] US [groʊ] verb (grew, grown)  Phrasal Verbs   grow into sth ■If children grow into clothes, they gradually become big enough to wear them. （孩子）长得适合穿（以前嫌大的衣服）
UK [grəʊ] US [groʊ] verb (grew, grown)  Phrasal Verbs   grow on sb ■If someone or something grows on you, you like them more and more although you did not like them at first 逐渐为（某人）所喜爱；使（某人）越来越喜欢
•I wasn't sure about this album when I bought it but it's really grown on me.我买这张专辑的时候心里也没想甚么，但是渐渐地我越听越喜欢了。

UK [grəʊ] US [groʊ] verb (grew, grown)  Phrasal Verbs   grow out of sth CLOTHES  ■If children grow out of clothes, they become too big to fit into them. （孩子）长大而穿不上（原来合身的衣服）INTEREST  ■If you grow out of an interest or way of behaving, you stop having or doing it as you become older （随着年龄增长而）放弃，戒除，改掉（原来的习惯）
•He wants to join the army when he leaves school, but I hope he'll grow out of the idea.他毕业后想去参军，但我希望他随着年龄的增长会改变这种想法。
IDEA  ■If an idea grows out of another one, it develops from it 由…发展而成；源于
•The idea for the story grew out of a strange experience I had last year.这部短篇小说的构思源自我去年的一次奇特经历。

UK [grəʊ] US [groʊ] verb (grew, grown)  Phrasal Verbs   grow up PERSON   ESSENTIAL  ■to gradually become an adult 长大成人；成长；成熟
•I grew up in Scotland (= I lived in Scotland when I was young).我是在苏格兰长大的。

•Taking responsibility for yourself is part of the process of growing up.承担起自己的责任是成长过程的一部分。
CITY  ■If a town or city grows up in a particular place or way, it develops there or in that way （城镇在某个特定的地方或以特定的方式）形成，发展，兴起
•The city grew up originally as a crossing point on the river.这个城市最初是从河流的一个渡口发展起来的。





turn, get, grow, become, come, go

这组词都有“变成，成为”的意思，其区别是：
turn: 侧重指变得与原来截然不同，有时含贬义。
get: 常指某人或某物有意无意地获得引起变化的因素，结果使变成另一状态。
grow: 常指逐渐地变成新状态，强调渐变的过程。
become: 最普通用词，作为连系动词，指从一个状态向另一个状态的变化。
come: 侧重变化的经过或过程，多用于不良情况。
go: 作为连系动词，通常与形容词连用，指进入某种状态，从而发生变化，多指不好的状态。



plant, grow

plant: 移植,移栽已经长成秧苗的植物 plant the trees
grow: 使某种植物在某地生长着或使其发展下去, trees are growing


vi. 发展；生长；渐渐变得…
 - expand, go way
vt. 使生长；种植；扩展
 - crop, plant
examples: 英 [ɡrəʊ] 美 [ɡroʊ]
v.增加；生长；变成；种植；逐渐开始

(1) How tall you've grown!(2) Plants cannot grow well in the absence of water.(3) She is growing into a beautiful young woman.(4) This district used to grow cotton on a large scale.(5) She has a hot temper, but you will soon grow to like her.
(1) 你都长这麽高了!(2) 没有水,植物就不能茁壮地生长。(3) 她渐渐出落成美丽的姑娘。(4) 这个地区过去大量种棉花。(5) 她脾气躁，但不久你就会喜欢她了。

translation:
n. 生长; 增长; 一茬植株; 肿块，肿瘤

分布：生长(60%)，发展(37%)，种植(3%)


成长(grow成长)[-th表名词,通常指抽象名词]
n.生长,增长,发展Calcium is good to the growth of your bones.钙有助于你的骨骼生长.



US [groʊθ] noun  ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■The growth of a person, animal or plant is its process of increasing in size 成长；生长；发育
•A balanced diet is essential for healthy growth.营养均衡的饮食对于健康发育是不可或缺的。

•Plant growth is most noticeable in spring and early summer.在春天和初夏之时， 植物的生长最为明显。
 ESSENTIAL  uncountable ■an increase in the size or the importance of something 增多；增强；增长；增大
•The government is trying to limit population growth.政府正在努力控制人口增长。

•The rapid growth of opposition to the plan has surprised the council.反对这一计划的势力突然激增，让政务委员会惊诧不已。

•Electronic publishing is a growth area (= an area of activity that is increasing in size and developing quickly).电子出版业是一个正在发展壮大的产业。
countable ■a lump (= solid mass) growing on the outside or inside of a person, animal or plant which is caused by a disease （疾病引起的体内或体外的）肿块，肿瘤，赘生物
•a cancerous growth on the liver肝脏上的恶性肿瘤
countable or uncountable ■something which has grown 生长物；长成物；产物
•Graham came back from holiday with a week's growth of beard on his chin.格拉汉姆渡假回来了，下巴上的胡子一星期都没有刮。




n. 增长；发展； [生理] 生长；种植
 - development, making, advance, increase, progress
examples: 英 [ɡrəʊθ] 美 [ɡroʊθ]
n.【U】增长；生长；发展；种植n.【C】生长物；【医】瘤;赘生物

(1) Their growth rate is quite slow, but continuous.(2) We are entering a period of rapid population growth.(3) Lack of demand will slow (down) our economic growth.(4) Cold weather retards the growth of the crops.(5) Magnesium is the nutrient element in plant growth.(6) The treatment arrested the growth of the disease.(7) It's the company's policy to sacrifice short-term profits for the sake of long-term growth.(8) Have an apple of our own growth.(9) The abandoned garden was left to a wanton growth of weeds.
(1) 其增长速度是相当缓慢,但持续。(2) 我们正在进入人类快速增长的时期。(3) 市场需求低就要拖慢我们的经济增长速度。(4) 寒冷的天气妨碍了庄稼生长。(5) 镁是植物生长的营养要素。(6) 治疗抑制了病情的发展。(7) 为长期发展而牺牲短期利润是公司的方针。(8) 尝尝我们自己种的苹果吧。(9) 荒园里杂草丛生。
[sound:youdao-b7cacfe3-8d943d71-b571dbc3-144a70e5-a62649a7.mp3]

translation:
n. 保证，担保; 保证人，保证书; 抵押品
vt. 保证，担保

时态：guaranteed, guaranteeing, guarantees


→词源同warranty.
n.保证,保证书v.保证,担保The guard guards the guarantee in the garden regardless of the hazard.卫兵不顾危险看守着花园里的抵押品.
【反】vouch（vt 担保）



noun  IMPROVER  countable or uncountable ■a promise that something will be done or will happen, especially a written promise by a company to repair or change a product that develops a fault within a particular period of time 保证，担保；（尤指公司保证对产品保修或包退的）保修单，包换单
•The system costs £99.95 including postage, packing and a 12-month guarantee.包括邮资、包装费用，该系统价格共计99.95英镑，保用12个月。

•The video recorder comes with/has a two-year guarantee.这台录像机保修期为两年。

•a money-back guarantee退款保证

•[+ that] The United Nations has demanded a guarantee from the army that food convoys will not be attacked.联合国要求这支军队保证不攻击护送粮食的车队。

•[+ (that)] There is no guarantee (that) the discussions will lead to a deal.商谈不一定能达成任何协议。

•A product as good as that is a guarantee of commercial success (= It is certain to be successful).那样好的产品质量就是成功获利的保证。

•The shop said they would replace the television as it was still under guarantee.商店说会给我们退换那台电视机，因为它还没有过包退期。
countable ■a formal agreement to take responsibility for something, such as the payment of someone else's debt 担保countable specialized ■something valuable which you give to someone temporarily while you do what you promised to do for them, and which they will keep if you fail to do it 担保物；抵押品
[ˌgær.ən'ti:] verb transitive PROMISE  保证   IMPROVER  ■If a product is guaranteed, the company that made it promises to repair or change it if a fault develops within a particular period of time 保修；包换
•The fridge is guaranteed for three years.这个冰箱保修期是三年。
 IMPROVER  ■to promise that something will happen or exist 保证；担保；保障
•[+ two objects] European Airlines guarantees its customers top-quality service.欧洲航空公司保证为乘客提供最好的服务。

•The label on this bread says it is guaranteed free of/from preservatives (= it contains no preservatives).这种面包的标签上写着保证不含防腐剂。
■If you guarantee someone's debt, you formally promise to accept the responsibility for that debt if the person fails to pay it. 为…作保；担保；承诺对…负法律责任
[ˌgær.ən'ti:] verb transitive MAKE CERTAIN  确保  ■If something guarantees something else, it makes certain that it will happen 确保，使必然发生
•[+ (that)] The £50 deposit guarantees (that) people return the boats after their hour has finished.50英镑的押金会确保人们在划完船后将船归还。
■If something is guaranteed to happen or have a particular result, it is certain that it will happen or have that result 肯定…必然发生；肯定会有某种结果
•[+ to infinitive] Just looking at a picture of the sea is guaranteed to make me feel sick.哪怕是看一眼大海的图片，我都会有晕船的感觉。





insure, promise, pledge, guarantee, assure, ensure

这组词都有“保证”的意思，其区别是：
insure: 常与ensure换用，但前者多指经济方面的保证、保险。
promise: 侧重表自己的主观意向，设法用语言使人感到稳当可靠。
pledge: 正式用词，指通过郑重许诺、协议或立誓等保证承担某一义务或遵守某一原则。
guarantee: 指对事物的品质或人的行为及履行义务、义务等承担责任的保证。
assure: 侧重指消除某人思想上的怀疑或担心，从而有达到目的的保证感，但不如ensure普通。
ensure: 侧重使人相信某个行为或力量产生的结果。



assurance, guarantee, pledge

这组词都有“保证，担保”的意思，其区别是：
assurance: 指用语言保证以消除人们思想上的怀疑与担心。
guarantee: 一般指以口头的、协定或合同的形式作为保证、担保，强调口头承诺，含违背许诺，则予以补偿之意。
pledge: 普通用词，指严肃地承诺、信守原则，常以个人名誉作为承诺的保证。


n. [金融] 保证； [法] 担保；保证人；保证书； [经] 抵押品
 - assurance, certification, commitment, warranty, pledge
vt. [金融] 保证； [法] 担保
 - assure, undertake, swear for
examples: 英 [ˌɡærən'tiː] 美 [ˌɡærən'tiː]
n.保证；保证书；担保；担保人；抵押品vt.保证；担保

(1) A diploma is no guarantee of efficiency.(2) I guarantee that this will not happen again.(3) We guarantee the fastness of these dyes.(4) If the guarantee goes to Beijing to petition again, then the four guarantors will lose their jobs.(5) Article 7 Guarantors should not provide guarantee for money-losingoverseas enterprises.(6) I can offer my land as a guarantee.(7) The guard guards the guarantee in the garden regardless of the hazard.(8) A diploma is no guarantee of efficiency.(9) We paid large fees to the Loan Guarantee Board.(10) We guarantee the fastness of these dyes.

(1) 持有文凭不能保证工作效率一定高。(2) 我保证此类事情不会再发生。(3) 我们担保这些染料不褪色。(4) 如果被担保的人再次去北京上访，这四个担保人将丢失他们的工作。(5) 第七条担保人不得为经营亏损企业提供对外担保。(6) 我可拿出我的地产作抵押品。(7) 卫兵不顾危险看守着花园里的抵押品。(8) 持有文凭不能保证工作效率一定高。(9) 我们付给了贷款保证委员会大笔的费用。(10) 我们担保这些染料不褪色。

translation:
n. 警卫; 狱吏，看守; 护卫队; 防护装置
vt. 保卫，守护; 看守; 加防护装置; 谨慎使用
vi. 警惕; 警卫

时态：guarded, guarding, guards
分布：警卫(36%)，守卫(23%)，看守(14%)，保卫(12%)，防护装置(4%)，警戒(4%)，哨兵(4%)，提防(3%)


→词源同ward.
v./n.保卫,守卫,提防n.哨兵,警卫,看守The guard guards the guarantee in the garden regardless of the hazard.卫兵不顾危险看守着花园里的抵押品.



US [gɑ:rd] noun countable PERSON WHO PROTECTS  守卫   IMPROVER  ■a person or group of people whose job is to protect a person, place or thing from danger or attack, or to prevent a person such as a criminal from escaping 卫兵，警卫；看守，守卫
•prison guards狱警

•security guards保安

•There are guards posted (= standing and watching) at every entrance.每个入口处都设了卫兵。

•Armed guards are posted around the site.现场周围设了武装警卫。

•The frontier is patrolled by border guards.边境警卫队沿国境巡逻。
be under guard ■to be kept in a place by a group of people who have weapons 处于武装人员的保护（或守卫）之下：
•The ex-President was under armed guard in the Palace.前总统在宫中处于武装警卫的保护之下。
stand/keep guard (also be on guard) ■to be responsible for protecting someone or something, or for preventing someone from escaping 守卫；站岗；看守
•Two of the soldiers kept guard over the captured guns.两名士兵看守着缴获的枪支。

•Armed police stand guard outside the house.武装员警在房外守卫。
the changing of the guard ■a ceremony held outside Buckingham Palace in London when one set of soldiers replaces the soldiers who have finished their time on duty standing outside the palace 白金汉宫皇家卫队换岗（仪式）
UK [gɑ:d] US [gɑ:rd] noun countable ON A TRAIN  列车上  UK (US conductor) ■a railway official who travels on and is responsible for a train 列车长
UK [gɑ:d] US [gɑ:rd] noun countable DEVICE  装置  ■a device that protects a dangerous part of something or that protects something from getting damaged 保护装置；保护用品；保护器
•a fire guard火灾防护装置

•a trigger guard（锁定）枪（扳机）的保险

•The helmet has a face guard attached.这个头盔带有一个防护面罩。

UK [gɑ:d] US [gɑ:rd] noun countable be on your guard ■to be careful to avoid being tricked or getting into a dangerous situation 警惕；提防；警戒
•You always have to be on your guard against pickpockets.你要时时提防扒手。

UK [gɑ:d] US [gɑ:rd] noun countable catch sb off guard ■to surprise someone by doing something which they are not expecting and are not ready for 乘（某人）不备；使（某人）措手不及；趁（某人）不警惕时（做某事）
UK [gɑ:d] US [gɑ:rd] noun countable  drop / lower  your guard ■to stop being careful to avoid danger or difficulty 警惕；提防；警戒
•Once he knew I wasn't a journalist, he dropped his guard and even let me take a photograph of him.当他知道我不是记者的时候，他立刻放松了警惕，甚至让我为他拍照。

UK [gɑ:d] US [gɑ:rd] verb transitive WATCH  看守   IMPROVER  ■to protect someone or something from being attacked or stolen 保卫；守卫；保护
•Soldiers guard the main doors of the embassy.大使馆的主要门口都有士兵把守。
 IMPROVER  ■to watch someone and make certain they do not escape from a place 看守；监视
•Five prison officers guarded the prisoners.五名狱警看守着犯人。

UK [gɑ:d] US [gɑ:rd] verb transitive NOT TELL  保守  ■to keep information secret 保守（秘密）；遮掩
•Journalists jealously (= carefully) guard their sources of information.记者们非常小心，对消息来源守口如瓶。

UK [gɑ:d] US [gɑ:rd] verb transitive   Phrasal Verbs   guard against sth ■to take careful action in order to try to prevent something from happening 防止；防范
•Regular exercise helps guard against heart disease.经常锻炼有助于预防心脏病。





shelter, guard, harbour, safeguard, defend, shield, protect

这组词都有“保护、保卫”的意思，其区别是：
shelter: 通常指寻找安全地方躲避风雨或使人免遭危害。
guard: 普通用词，指保持警惕以防可能的攻击或伤害。
harbour: 贬义词，指隐匿或非法保护、窝藏。
safeguard: 语气强，指采取积极措施预防可能发生的一切攻击或危险。
defend: 普通用词，指用武力或其它措施使人或物不受损害，消除危险。用作比喻时，指坚持某种行动、决定或意见。
shield: 语气比protect强，但侧重防止迫在眉睫的攻击或伤害。
protect: 普通用词，指用某种手段作为防御工具以防危险或伤害。


n. 守卫；警戒；护卫队； [安全] 防护装置
 - vigilance, alertness
vi. 警惕
 - keep one's eye on the ball, keep one's eyes peeled
vt. 保卫；监视
 - watching, shield
examples: 英 [ɡɑːd] 美 [ɡɑːrd]
v.看守；守卫；保卫；提防n.警戒；哨兵；防护装置；警卫；【体】后卫

(1) He keeps a dog to guard the house.(2) The dog guarded the house against strangers.(3) Ten soldiers were detailed to guard the bridge.(4) You must guard against catching a cold.(5) Be on guard when somebody flatters you.(6) He hit him when his guard was down.(7) A sentry stood on guard at the corner.(8) The guard did not quit his post all night long.(9) The guard unlocked the cuffs of the prisoner.
(1) 他养一条狗看家。(2) 狗守卫着房屋，不让陌生人进去。(3) 十名战士被派去保卫那座桥梁。(4) 你必须小心以防感冒。(5) 有人奉承你时，一定要当心。(6) 他乘其不备击中了他。(7) 一个哨兵在角落里站岗。(8) 那个哨兵整夜都没有离开他的哨位。(9) 警卫打开了囚犯的手铐。
[sound:youdao-baa8f622-aea2af99-d84dad49-71d27472-0d1330e0.mp3]

translation:
vt. 推测; 猜测，臆测; 猜中; 假定，认为
vi. 猜，猜测; 猜对
n. 猜测; 推断

时态：guessed, guessing, guesses
分布：猜测(56%)，猜想(21%)，推测(14%)，猜中(7%)，以为(2%)


→词源同get, 得到。
v./n.猜测,推测;以为;猜想[同]surmiseI guess the guest's gesture suggested that he could not digest well.我猜想客人的手势暗示了他消化不良.



verb intransitive or transitive  ESSENTIAL  ■to give an answer to a particular question when you do not have all the facts and so cannot be certain if you are correct 猜测；推测；估计
•I didn't know the answer, so I had to guess.我不知道答案，所以只好猜了。

•On the last question, she guessed right/wrong.最后一道题目她猜对／错了。

•[+ question word] Guess when this was built.猜一猜这是甚么时候建造的。

•[+ (that)] I guessed (that) she was your sister.我猜她是你妹妹。

•She asked me to guess her age.她让我猜她的年龄。

•I guessed the total amount to be about £50,000.我估计总额约为五万英镑。
 ESSENTIAL  ■to give the correct answer or make the correct judgment 猜中；猜对；猜到
•[+ question word] I bet you can't guess how old he is.我打赌你猜不出他多大了。

•She guessed the answer first time.她第一次就猜中了答案。

•"You've got a new job, haven't you?" "Yes, how did you guess?"“你换新工作了，是吗？”“对呀，你怎么猜出来的？”
Guess what?  ADVANCED  informal ■used before telling someone something interesting or surprising （用来告诉某人有趣或令人惊奇的事情）你猜怎么着?
•Guess what? We won the match 4-0.你猜到吗？我们4比0赢了比赛。
I guess informal ■used when you believe something is true or likely but are not certain （表示没有把握）我想，我认为
•[+ (that)] I guess (that) things are pretty hard for you now.我想你现在的日子过得不太好吧。

[ges] verb intransitive or transitive keep sb guessing ■to not tell someone what you are going to do next 让（某人）捉摸不定；让（某人）猜不透
[ges] verb intransitive or transitive   Phrasal Verbs   transitive guess at sth ■to try to imagine something when you have little knowledge or experience of it 猜测；推测；想像
•There are no photographs of him so we can only guess at what he looked like.没有他的照片，所以我们只能猜测他的长相。

[ges] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■an attempt to give the right answer when you are not certain if you are correct 猜测；推测
•Go on - have/make/ US take a guess.来啊——猜一猜嘛。

•Both teams made some wild guesses (= ones which were made without much thought) , none of which were right.两个队都是瞎猜一通，没有一个猜对的。

•"What's the time?" "It's about 5 o'clock, at a guess (= without knowing exactly)."“几点了？”“差不多五点吧，我猜的。”
■someone's opinion about something which is formed without any knowledge of the situation 猜想
•"I wonder why she's not here." "My guess is that her car has broken down."“我奇怪她为甚么不在这儿。”“我猜她的车抛锚了吧。”
be anyone's guess ■If a piece of information is anyone's guess, no one knows it 谁也不知道；谁也拿不准
•"So what's going to happen now?" "That's anyone's guess."“那现在又会发生甚么呢？”“那谁知道。”

[ges] noun countable  Your guess is as good as mine. informal ■something you say when you do not know the answer to a question 我跟你一样也不知道
•"What's he doing?" "Your guess is as good as mine."“他在做甚么啊？”“我也不知道。”





presume, suppose, guess, postulate, assume

这组词都有“假设，猜想，推测”的意思，其区别是：
presume: 侧重以过去经验或根据现实的某些感觉把某事认定为是事实。
suppose: 常用词，意义较广泛，指缺乏确切事实，根据一些现象进行的推测，也可指为论证而提出合乎逻辑推理的某种假定，有时仅表示自己的意见。
guess: 常用词，指毫无根据仅凭个人主观臆断或碰运气的猜测。
postulate: 指为证实一个理论的正确性而进行的假设。
assume: 指有很少或完全无根据的武断推测或不合逻辑的推理。


vt. 猜测；认为；推测；猜中
 - expect, count, find, feel, make
vi. 猜；推测；猜中
 - speculate
n. 猜测；推测
 - speculation, theory, projection
examples: 英 [ɡes] 美 [ɡes]
v.推测；猜中；以为n.猜测；猜想

(1) I don't really know, I'm just guessing.(2) We could only guess at her motives.(3) He guessed the number of the beans in the jar.(4) I guess he was wrong.(5) I'll give you three guesses.(6) My guess is that he didn't come because his parents wouldn't let him do.
(1) 我真的不知道, 我仅仅是猜想。(2) 我们只能猜测她的动机(3) 他猜出了缸里豆子有多少。(4) 我想他错了(5) 我让你猜三次。(6) 我想,他没来是因为父母不让他来。
[sound:youdao-1febb183-d454e94b-4ef27b6b-19bbfb5c-4a930a01.mp3]

translation:
n. 客人; 旅客; 特邀嘉宾; [动]寄生虫
v. 做特邀嘉宾; 做客串; 做特约演员
adj. 客人的; 客座的; 为客人准备的

分布：客人(82%)，宾客(6%)，招待(5%)，做客(3%)，做特邀嘉宾(1%)，做特约演员(1%)，客串(1%)，特别来宾(1%)


→来自ghos, 陌生人，客人，词源同host, hospitable.
n.客人,宾客,旅客I guess the guest's gesture suggested that he could not digest well.我猜想客人的手势暗示了他消化不良.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a person who is staying with you, or a person you have invited to a social occasion, such as a party or a meal 客人；宾客
•150 guests were invited to the wedding.150位客人被邀参加婚礼。

•We have guests (US houseguests)staying this weekend.有客人到家来和我们一起度周末。

•Is he on the guest list ?他在不在宾客名单上？

•He is a paying guest (= He pays for the use of a room in someone's home).他是个寄宿房客。
 ESSENTIAL  ■a person who is staying in a hotel （宾馆的）旅客，宿客
•We would like to remind all our guests to leave their keys at reception before they depart.我们要提醒所有客人在离开前将房间锁匙交还到服务台。
 ADVANCED  ■a person, such as an entertainer , who has been invited to appear on a television or radio programme or in a performance （广播电视节目中的）特邀嘉宾，特别来宾；客串演员
•Our special guest on the programme tonight is Robert de Niro.今晚我们节目请到的特别嘉宾是罗拔．迪尼路。

•Madonna made a guest appearance at the concert.玛丹娜担任了那场音乐会的特别嘉宾。

•Simon Rattle will be the guest conductor with the London Symphony Orchestra.西蒙‧拉特尔将在伦敦交响乐团担任客席指挥。

[gest] noun countable Be my guest. ■something you say when you give someone permission to do or use something 别客气；请便
•"Can I try out your new bicycle?" "Be my guest."“我试骑一下你的新脚踏车可以吗？”“骑吧。”

[gest] verb intransitive ■If a person, especially an entertainer , guests on a programme or show, they are invited to appear or perform on it （尤指娱乐演员）当特约演员，作为特约演员参加
•He guests on their latest video.他在他们最近录制的节目里担任特别嘉宾。





passenger, client, guest, customer, visitor

这组词都有“客人，访问者”的意思，其区别是：
passenger: 主要指乘坐交通工具的游人或旅客。
client: 与customer同义，多指进入商店被店员接待或购物的人。
guest: 多指事先受到激请而来，并受到欢迎与招待的宾客。也可指付钱居住者。
customer: 主要指交易一方的买主、主顾。
visitor: 普通用词，指出差、访问、旅游、参观或到旅馆投宿的人。


n. 客人， [经] 宾客；顾客
 - customer, client, consumer
vt. 款待，招待
 - serve, invite, attend
vi. 作客，寄宿
 - board, stay over
examples: 英 [ɡest] 美 [ɡest]
n.客人；宾客；特别来宾；[动植物]寄生生物v.做特邀嘉宾；做特约演员；客串；招待；做客

(1) They are coming to the party as my guests.(2) These Indian guest are familiar with this book.(3) She deleted our names from the guest list.(4) She made a guest appearance on his TV show.(5) She guested on several chat shows while visiting Britain.(6) He guested on a television series.
(1) 他们作为我的客人出席晚会。(2) 这些印度客人对这本书很熟悉。(3) 她把我们的名字从宾客名单中删去了。(4) 她在他的电视节目中出场客串。(5) 她访问英国时做过几个访谈节目的特邀嘉宾。(6) 他客串了一个电视系列剧。
[sound:youdao-e6524cf5-57bf4486-1205a6d3-f723ba91-3c8b56db.mp3]

translation:
n. 指导，引导; 导航; 领导

分布：指导(82%)，引导(15%)，导航(3%)


n.引导,指导He did the work under the teacher's guidance.他在老师的指导下做了这件工作.



noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■help and advice about how to do something or about how to deal with problems connected with your work, education, or personal relationships 指导；引导
•I've always looked to my father for guidance in these matters.在这些问题上我总是依靠父亲指点迷津。

•careers guidance职业咨询指导
■the process of directing the flight of a missile or rocket （导弹或火箭的）制导，导引
•a missile guidance system导弹制导系统





guidance, assistance

guidance: 指导，领导
assistance: 帮助，协助


n. 指导，引导；领导
 - direction, aiming, lead, steering
examples: 英 ['ɡaɪdns] 美 ['ɡaɪdns]
n.指导；引导；导航

(1) Under his guidance, we finished the work smoothly.(2) She is a marriage guidance counselor.(3) Religion provides many people with guidance.(4) We should not do anything under the guidance of instincts.(5) The airplane has a sophisticated electronic guidance system.
(1) 在他的指导下，我们顺利地完成了工作。(2) 她是婚姻问题的顾问。(3) 宗教为很多人起到引导的作用。(4) 我们不应该凭着直觉做事情。(5) 这架飞机有一套尖端的电子导航系统。

translation:
adj. 内疚的; 有罪的

分布：有罪的(72%)，内疚的(28%)


a.(of)有罪的,内疚的The guide disguised his guilty of mixing the liquor with a liter of liquid.导游把酒与一公升液体混合的罪过掩饰起来.
【反】exonerate（vt 免除；证明无罪）－prove guilty（证明有罪）



US [-tˌi] adjective FEELING  感觉   ESSENTIAL  ■feeling guilt 内疚的；愧疚的；自责的
•I feel so guilty about forgetting her birthday.我忘了她的生日，深感内疚。

•She must have done something wrong, because she's looking so guilty.她一定是做错甚么事了，因为她一脸愧疚。

•You've got a guilty conscience - that's why you can't sleep.你问心有愧——所以会睡不着觉。

UK ['gɪl.ti] US [-tˌi] adjective RESPONSIBLE  承担责任的   ESSENTIAL  ■responsible for breaking a law 犯了罪的；有过失的；有罪责的
•The jury has to decide whether a person is guilty or innocent of a crime.陪审团必须就一个人是否有罪作出裁决。

•A person accused of a crime is presumed innocent until proven guilty.一个被指控犯罪的人在被证明有罪之前是假定无罪的。

•The company pleaded guilty (= They formally admitted their guilt in court) to the charge of manslaughter.这家公司在法庭上认罪，承认了对其过失杀人罪的指控。
 Compare innocent the guilty party ■the person who has done something wrong or who has committed a crime 有过错的一方；犯罪的一方




criminal, guilty

这组词都有“犯罪的”的意思，其区别是：
criminal: 侧重指某种行为是违犯法律的，因而应受到惩罚。
guilty: 主要指某种行为违反道德标准，也可指违犯法律。


adj. 有罪的；内疚的
 - sinful, culpable
examples: 英 ['ɡɪlti] 美 ['ɡɪlti]
adj.有罪的；内疚的

(1) The court found him guilty.(2) The man was proved guilty of murder.(3) A man is accounted innocent until he is proven guilty.(4) His answer evidenced a guilty conscience.(5) He had no sense of shame and never felt guilty.
(1) 法官判他有罪。(2) 这个男子被证实犯了杀人罪。(3) 一个人未被证明有罪前，被视为是清白的。(4) 他的回答证明他良心有愧。(5) 他毫无羞耻之心，而且从不觉得内疚。
[sound:youdao-60de9b24-7266060e-0e33ed21-8002cb67-4b3ee7de.mp3]

translation:
n. 海湾; 分歧; 波斯湾; （地面的）裂口
vt. 吞没; 卷进

分布：海湾(87%)，鸿沟(10%)，吞没(3%)


→词源同whelm, 淹没。用来指海湾。
n.海湾Regretfully, we can't regulate the irregular liner on the gulf.遗憾的是我们不能调整海湾上不定期的班船.



noun AREA  地区   ADVANCED  countable ■a very large area of sea surrounded on three sides by a coast 海湾
•the Gulf of Mexico墨西哥湾
the Gulf only singular ■the Persian Gulf and the countries around it 波斯湾；波斯湾各国；海湾国家
•The Gulf states include Iran, Iraq, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain, Oman, Qatar, and the United Arab Emirates.海湾国家包括伊朗、伊拉克、沙乌地阿拉伯、科威特、巴林、阿曼、卡塔尔以及阿拉伯联合酋长国。
countable formal ■a very large deep hole in the ground （地面的）裂口，深坑，深渊
[gʌlf] noun DIFFERENCE  不同  countable usually singular ■an important difference between the ideas, opinions, or situations of two groups of people 不可逾越的鸿沟；巨大的差距；隔阂
•There is a widening gulf between the middle classes and the poorest sections of society.中产阶级和社会最贫困阶层之间的贫富差距在日益加大。

•It is hoped that the peace plan will bridge the gulf (= reduce the very large difference) between the government and the rebels.人们希望和平计划能够缩小政府和叛乱分子之间的分歧。





bay, gulf

这两个名词均有“海湾”之意。
bay: 指海岸线上一大块凹入的地方，是港口的所在地。
gulf: 一般比bay大，但比sea小。指大片深入到陆地中，由海岸围绕成半圆形的海水区域。


n. [地理] 海湾；深渊；分歧；漩涡
 - bay, deep, variance
vt. 吞没
 - engulf, swallow
examples: 英 [ɡʌlf] 美 [ɡʌlf]
n.海湾；鸿沟vt.吞没

(1) The gulf extends northward.(2) The Gulf War has sapped Iraqi vitality badly.(3) Thousands of ships enwombed in the gulf of mexico.(4) Between him and Mr Smith there was a great gulf fixed.(5) I think there is no gulf between my daughter and I.
(1) 海湾向北方延伸。(2) 海湾战争使伊拉克大伤元气。(3) 数千艘的船深藏在墨西哥海湾中。(4) 他与史密斯之间有一道永远不可逾越的鸿沟。(5) 我认为我和我女儿之间没有隔阂。

vt. & vi. 胶合; 涂以树胶; 使…有粘性

时态：gummed, gumming, gums
分布：树胶(43%)，齿龈(20%)，牙床(20%)，搞砸(8%)，用牙床嚼(5%)，以树胶粘合(2%)，粘性物质(2%)


→1.树胶，来自埃及语。
n.树胶;口香糖The funny cunning runner uses his gum gun before sunrise or after sunset.滑稽乖巧的赛跑者在日出之前或日落之后使用胶皮枪.



noun MOUTH  嘴  countable ■either of the two areas of firm pink flesh inside the mouth which cover the bones into which the teeth are fixed 齿龈，牙龈，牙床
•sore gums牙龈疼痛

[gʌm] noun STICKY SUBSTANCE  黏性物质  uncountable ■a sticky substance which comes from the stems of some trees and plants, or a type of glue used for sticking together pieces of paper 树胶；树脂uncountable ■chewing gum  or bubble gum  (= a soft sweet that you crush with your teeth but do not swallow) 口香糖；泡泡糖countable UK ■used in the names of some chewy sweets with fruit flavours 透明果味糖；胶姆糖；橡皮软糖
•fruit/wine gums水果胶姆糖／酒胶糖

[gʌm] noun By gum! UK old-fashioned informal ■used to express surprise （表示惊奇或强烈感情）啊呀！天哪！天啊！
•By gum, he's a big lad!好家伙，他块头真大啊！

[gʌm] verb transitive (-mm-) slightly old-fashioned ■If you gum one piece of paper to another, you stick them together using glue 用胶黏
•The labels were already gummed to the envelopes.标签已经黏贴在信封上了。

[gʌm] verb transitive (-mm-) slightly old-fashioned   Phrasal Verbs   [M often passive] gum sth up ■to prevent something from working or opening in the usual way by covering it with a sticky substance （由于覆有黏性物质而）黏住，使出故障，使运转不正常
•When I woke up this morning my eyes were all gummed up.今天早晨我醒来时，眼睛被眼屎给糊住了。

examples: 英 [ɡʌm] 美 [ɡʌm]

(1) He has some sore swellings on his gum.(2) The tree is covered with gum.(3) Heart attack patients usually have gum diseases!(4) He likes chewing gum.(5) You'll gum up the jobs if you do it this way.(6) It may well gum up the joint.(7) You can gum this piece of wood onto the wall.(8) His pocket was all gummed up with candy.

translation:
n. 枪; 发令枪声; 受雇杀人的枪手; 喷射器
vt. 射击（某人）; 给…加大油门; 打猎
vi. 用枪打猎

时态：gunned, gunning, guns
分布：枪(86%)，炮(10%)，用枪打猎(2%)，枪击(1%)，打开节流阀(1%)


→词源不详，可能来自妇女名Gunilda, 字面意思为战斗，击打。gun, 击打，词源同bane, offend. hilda, 砍，杀，词源同gladiator.
n.枪,炮,手枪The funny cunning runner uses his gum gun before sunrise or after sunset.滑稽乖巧的赛跑者在日出之前或日落之后使用胶皮枪.



noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■a weapon from which bullets or shells (= explosive containers) are fired 枪；炮
•The British police do not carry guns.英国员警不佩带枪支。

•You could hear the noise of guns firing in the distance.你可以听到远处的枪声。
■in sport, a device which makes a very loud sudden noise as a signal to start a race （体育比赛中用来表示比赛开始的）信号枪
•At the gun, the runners sprinted away down the track.信号枪一响，运动员们便沿着跑道飞奔起来。
■a device which you hold in your hand and use for sending out a liquid or object 喷射器；喷射枪
•a spray gun喷枪

•a staple gunU 形钉枪
⇒ See also staple-gunhired gun mainly US informal ■a person who is paid to shoot and kill someone 受雇杀人的枪手
[gʌn] noun countable be under the gun mainly US ■to feel worried because you have to do something by a particular time or in a particular way 因为须在限定时间内或以特定方式完成任务而倍感压力
•Al's under the gun to decide by the end of the month whether to move with his company.艾伦因需在月底前决定是否和公司一起搬走而倍感压力。

[gʌn] noun countable with guns blazing (also all guns blazing) ■If you do something, especially argue, with guns blazing, you do it with a lot of force and energy （尤指争吵）火药味十足地，真刀真枪地
•I went into the meeting with guns blazing, determined not to let him win.我进入会场的时候下定决心真刀真枪跟他争辩，决不让他得逞。

[gʌn] verb transitive (-nn-) mainly US old-fashioned informal ■to make an engine operate at a higher speed 使加速；使高速运转
•You must have been really gunning the engine to get here on time.你竟然准时到这儿了，肯定是一路飞驰而来。

[gʌn] verb transitive (-nn-) mainly US old-fashioned informal be gunning for sb informal ■to often criticize someone or be trying to cause trouble for them 时常指责（某人）；不时找（某人）的茬，经常挑衅
•She's been gunning for me ever since I got the promotion she wanted.自从我被提升到她觊觎的那个职位后，她就一直在找我的茬。

[gʌn] verb transitive (-nn-) mainly US old-fashioned informal   Phrasal Verbs   [M] gun sb down ■to shoot someone and kill or seriously injure them, often when they cannot defend themselves 用枪击伤，击毙（没有防御能力的人）
•The police officer was gunned down as he took his children to school.这名员警在送他的孩子去上学时被枪杀。





pistol, fifle, gun, cannon

这组词都有“枪，炮”的意思，其区别是：
pistol: 指手枪。
fifle: 指步枪类的枪。
gun: 系枪的通称。
cannon: 在军事上，现在gun指火炮，取代了cannon这一名词。


n. 枪枝；枪状物；持枪歹徒
 - gunman, rodman
examples: 英 [ɡʌn] 美 [ɡʌn]
n.枪；炮；节流阀vt.枪击；打开节流阀vi.用枪打猎

(1) The gun has a carry of 400 yards.(2) He was clubbed to death with a butt of a gun.(3) It's illegal to carry guns in our country.(4) The soldier saw a gun jutting out from a bush.(5) The gun has an elevation of 45 degrees.(6) Two soldiers dismounted the gun from the base.(7) I saw them gun down innocent women and children.
(1) 这枪的射程为四百码。(2) 他是被人用枪托殴打致死的。(3) 在我们国家，携带枪支是违法的。(4) 那士兵看见一支枪从矮树丛伸出来。(5) 这门炮的仰角为45度。(6) 两个战士把炮从底座上卸下来。(7) 我看到他们枪杀无辜的妇女和儿童。
[sound:youdao-26d2249b-fc6b7b15-b91982be-af33581b-25a373dd.mp3]

translation:
n. 健身房，体育馆; 大学预科，高级中学

分布：体育馆(79%)，健身房(21%)


→来自希腊语gymnos, 裸体，裸体健身者，现指健身馆。因在古希腊时期，人们习惯裸体锻炼，以展示人体之美。参照各古希腊裸体雕像。
体育馆(脱衣服锻炼的地方)[gymn=naked裸体的]
n.(gym)体育馆,健身房The astronaut, an astronomy fan, is astonished at the gymnastics show in the gymnasium.宇航员(一位天文学迷)对体育馆里的体操表演感到惊骇.



[dʒɪm'neɪ.zi.əm] (also gym)  formal noun countable ■a large room with weights for lifting, horizontal bars and other equipment for exercising the body and increasing strength 体育馆；健身房




playground, stadium, court, gymnasium

这组词都有“运动场，操场”的意思，其区别是：
playground: 一般指附属于学校或公园内的活动场地，也可指游乐场或儿童游戏场地。
stadium: 指周围有看台的露天大型运动场。
court: 通常指周围有围墙的专用球场。
gymnasium: 可简写为gym，指不受天气影响的室内体育馆、健身房或运动场馆。


n. 体育馆；健身房
 - gym, sports palace

n.体育馆；健身房(复数）gymnasia或gymnasiums.
(1) The child somersaulted across the gymnasium.(2) A new gymnasium has been built on our campus.(3) Our gymnasium lacks sports facilities.(4) He go to the gymnasium to practise every day.
(1) 那孩子翻著跟头从体育馆这头翻到那头。(2) 我们大学的校园里新建了一座体育馆。(3) 我们的健身房缺少运动器材。(4) 他每天都去健身房训练。

translation:
n. 绿豆; 鹰嘴豆; 绿豆种子; 克

分布：克(97%)，写出或画出的东西(3%)


→来自gerbh, 刮，刻，切，词源同carve,graph. 后指文字，字母。并于法国在1799年用于公制重量体系，克。



(UK also gramme) [græm] (written abbreviation g) (gm) noun [C or]  IMPROVER  ■a unit of mass equal to 0.001 kilograms （质量单位）克



n. 克；鹰嘴豆（用作饲料）
 - garbanzo, chick-pea
examples: 英 [ɡræm] 美 [ɡræm]
n.克abbr.语法（=grammar）suf.写出或画出的东西
(1) A dust particle weighs only a thousandth of a gram.(2) Sorry,but we sell the roast Beijing duck by the gram.
(1) 一粒尘埃的重量仅有千分之一克。(2) 对不起，我们是按克出售北京烤鸭的。
